gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮਾਂਝ ਬੈਠੇ ਬਿਨੁ ਬੋਹਿਥਾ ਨ ਪਾਰ ਪਰੈ ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰਸੈ ਬਿਨੁ ਧਾਤ ਨ ਕਨਿਕ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Maanjh Baitthay Binu Bohidaa N Paar Parai , Paaras Parasai Binu Dhaat N Kanik Hai ?
translation: Just as without embarking a ship, ocean cannot be crossed and without the touch of philosopher-stone, iron, copper or other metals cannot be turned into gold.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਬਿਨੁ ਗੰਗਾ ਨ ਪਾਵਨ ਅਾਨ ਜਲੁ ਹੈ ਨਾਰ ਨ ਭਤਾਰਿ ਬਿਨੁ ਸੁਤਨ ਅਨਿਕ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Binu Gangaa N Paavan Aan Jalu Hai , Naar N Bhataari Binu Soutan Anik Hai ?
translation: Just as no water is considered sacred other than the water of .river Ganges, and no child can be born without conjugal union of husband and wife.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਬਿਨੁ ਬੀਜ ਬੋੲੇ ਨਿਪਜੈ ਨ ਧਾਨ ਧਾਰਾ ਸੀਪ ਸ੍ਵਾਂਤ ਬੂੰਦ ਬਿਨੁ ਮੁਕਤਾ ਨ ਮਾਨਕ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Binu Beej Boay Nipajai N Dhaan Dhaaraa , Seep Svaant Boond Binu Moukataa N Maanak Hai ?
translation: Just as without sowing seeds, no crop can grow and no pearl can be formed in an oyster unless the swati drop of rain falls on it.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਗੁਰ ਭੇਟੇ ਬਿਨੁ ਜਨਮ ਮਰਨ ਮੇਟਿ ਜਨ ਨ ਜਨ ਕਹੈ ||੫੩੮||
transliteration: Taisay Gur Charan Sarani Gur Bhaytay Binu , Janam Maran Mayti Jan N Jan Kahai ?538?
translation: Similarly without taking refuge and consecration of True Guru, there is no other method or force that can end the repeated cycle of birth and death. One who is without the divine word of the Guru cannot be called a human being.  (538)
